isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYMPTOMS DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Fuel in Coolant

item.para: Leaking or cracked injector sleeve with injector O-ring failure
Cracked or porous head casting in fuel rail area

svcsubproc.title: Fuel in Coolant Leakage Test using High Pressure

item.para: Check for diesel fuel odor in coolant.
Coolant may be discolored if diesel fuel is present.

step1.para: Plug in the cylinder block heater to warm coolant.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use only the following procedure to remove the pressure type cap from the cooling system. Always allow the engine to cool first. Wrap a thick, heavy cloth around the cap. Loosen cap slowly; then pause a moment. This will avoid possible scalding by hot coolant or steam. Continue to turn cap to the left and remove.

step1.para: Remove cap from deaeration tank and fill with coolant to a level above the deaeration inlet line to tank.

Pressurize both fuel lines from the fuel filter header to cylinder heads to 550-690 kPa (80-100 psi) using the fuel line test adapter. Observe deaeration tank for air bubbles or loss of pressure at gauge.

item.para: If leak is found, remove cylinder head where leak was detected as described in the Engine Service Manual. Do all inspections and pressure test cylinder head to verify leak path. Replace or repair cylinder head, as necessary. If an injector sleeve was replaced, retest the cylinder head using the cylinder head pressure test plate.
If no leak is found, continue with Fuel in Coolant Leakage Test using Low Pressure.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel in Coolant Leakage Test using Low Pressure

item.para: Check for diesel fuel odor in coolant.
Coolant may be discolored if diesel fuel is present.

step1.para: Plug in the cylinder block heater to warm coolant.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use only the following procedure to remove the pressure type cap from the cooling system. Always allow the engine to cool first. Wrap a thick, heavy cloth around the cap. Loosen cap slowly; then pause a moment. This will avoid possible scalding by hot coolant or steam. Continue to turn cap to the left and remove.

step1.para: Remove cap from deaeration tank and fill with coolant to a level above the deaeration inlet line to tank.
Install radiator pressure tester at the coolant deaeration tank. Pressurize cooling system to 96 kPa (14 psi).
Remove fuel line banjo fittings/check valves from front of cylinder heads as described in the Engine Service Manual.
Observe fuel rail bores at cylinder heads for air or coolant leaks.

item.para: If leak is found, remove valve cover and fuel injectors as described in the Engine Service Manual. Observe injector bores for leakage. Replace or repair cylinder head, as necessary. After repair, pressurize cooling system to confirm repair.

If no leak is found, remove each cylinder head one at a time following the procedures as described in the Engine Service Manual. Perform all inspections and pressure test cylinder head to check for leak paths.
